document.masterDocTitle: Oribatid mites (Acari: Oribatida) recorded from Ireland: Catalogue, historical records, species habitats and geographical distribution, combinations, variations and synonyms

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Oribatid mites (Acari: Oribatida) recorded from Ireland: Catalogue, historical records, species habitats and geographical distribution, combinations, variations and synonyms

subSubSection.paragraph:
·
Eupelops acromios (Hermann, 1804)
*

· Original name:
Notaspis acromios Hermann, 1804
.
· In: Mémoire Aptérologique . Strassbourg. 154 pp, 91

· Historical combinations/variations:
Pelops acromios (Hermann) C.L. Koch, 1840
;
Pelops acromias
[sic] (Hermann) Halbert, 1915 ;
Phenopelops acromios (Hermann) Kunst 1958
.

·
Eupelops major (Hull, 1914)

· Original name:
Pelops major Hull, 1914
.
· In: British Oribatidae : notes on new and critical species. Naturalist , 1914, 249–250.

paragraph.materialsCitation: Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Sitka spruce forest ( Arroyo and Bolger 2008 ); Machair fixed (stable) dunes and Machair grassland (Arroyo and Bolger 2011); canopy in Sitka spruce forests (unpublished data). Counties: Galway, Laois and Wicklow .

subSubSection.paragraph:
·
Eupelops occultus (C.L. Koch, 1835)

· Original name:
Pelops occultus C.L. Koch, 1835
.
· In: Deutschlands Crustaceen, Myriapoden und Arachniden, 2(15).

· Synonyms:
Pelops parvus Mihelčič, 1953
;
Pelops brevicuspis Knülle, 1954
;
Eupelops nepotulus Sellnick 1960
[misidentification].
Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Cutaway raised bog and permanent pasture on peat ( Whelan 1976 ). Counties: Kildare .

·
Eupelops plicatus (C.L. Koch, 1835)
*

· Original name:
Celaeno plicata C.L. Koch, 1835
.
· In: Deutschlands Crustaceen, Myriapoden und Arachniden, 3(18).

· Historical combinations/variations:
Pelops plicatus (C.L. Koch) Oudemans, 1900
;
Phenopelops plicatus (C.L. Koch) Sellnick, 1960
.

Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Moss and debris from nests of sea birds ( Halbert 1915 ); agricultural grassland ( Valarasan 1971 ); bog, heather and permanent pasture on peat ( Longworth 1973 ); cutaway raised bog ( Whelan 1976 ); acid peat bog (Behan-Pelletier and Hill 1983 ); grass, soil on cliff, woodland and agricultural soil (Bolger In press), Machair grassland (Arroyo and Bolger 2011), raised bogs, Atlantic blanket bogs and fens (
Wisdom et al. 2011
); moss in canopy in Sikta spruce forests and soil in Scots pine forests (
Arroyo et al. (2012
, 2013b ); moss on soil and moss in canopy in oak forest (
Arroyo et al . 2013c
). Counties: Donegal , Dublin , Kerry , Kildare , Mayo , Offaly and Sligo .

Eupelops sulcatus (Oudemans, 1914)
*

· Original name:
Pelops sulcatus Oudemans, 1914
.
· In: Acarologisches aus Maulwurfsnestern. Archiv für Naturgeschichte , 10, 1–69.

· Synonyms:
Pelops curtipilus Berlese, 1916
;
Pelops depilatus Berlese, 1916
;
Pelops bilobus Sellnick, 1928
,
Eupelops bilobus (Sellnick) Ghilarov and Krivolutsky, 1975
.

·
Eupelops tardus (C.L. Koch, 1835)
*

· Original name:
Pelops tardus C.L. Koch, 1835
.
· In: Deutschlands Crustaceen, Myriapoden und Arachniden , 2(16).
Pérez-Ínigo, 1972.

Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Pasture, dune and
Salix
ditch at seashore (Purvis 1982); permanent pasture on peatland ( Whelan 1986 ); pastures and blanket bogs (rough grazing) (
Arroyo et al. 2009a
); Machair fixed (stable) dunes and Machair grassland (Arroyo and Bolger 2011); agricultural grassland (
Arroyo et al. 2015
; unpublished data); ant nests (
Arroyo et al. 2015
).
Counties: Donegal , Dublin , Galway , Kildare , Limerick , Mayo , Meath , Monaghan , Offaly , Tipperary and Wexford .

·
Eupelops torulosus (C.L. Koch, 1839)

· Original name:
Pelops torulosus C.L. Koch, 1839
.
· In: Deutschlands Crustaceen, Myriapoden und Arachniden, 30 (13).

·
Peloptulus gibbus Mihelčič, 1957

· Original name:
Peloptulus gibbus Mihelčič, 1957
.
· In: Zoologische Anzeiger , 158.

·
Peloptulus montanus Hull, 1914

· Original name:
Peloptulus montanus Hull, 1914
· In: The Naturalist , 216

·
Peloptulus phaenotus (C.L. Koch, 1844)
*

· Original name:
Pelops phaenotus C.L. Koch, 1844
.
· In: Deutschlands Crustaceen, Myriapoden und Arachniden, 39(23).

· Historical combinations/variations:
Peloptulus phaeonotus
[sic] (C.L. Koch)
Wisdom et al ., 2011
. Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s :
Sphagnum ( Halbert 1915 )
; cutaway raised bog and permanent pasture on peat ( Whelan 1976 ); pasture and dune at seashore (Purvis 1982); raised bogs, Atlantic blanket bogs and fens (
Wisdom et al. 2011
).

paragraph.materialsCitation: Counties: Kildare, Mayo, Offaly and Wexford .
